qas.question: How did Prior Diego think the members of the Holy Church acted?

answers.text: with an offensive amount of pomp and ceremony

qas.question: Who did Prior Diego admire more than the Holy Church?

Who did Diego and Dominic try to convert?

plausible_answers.text: the representatives of the Holy Church

qas.question: What was meet with much success?

context: <b5_0>Prior Diego<b5_0/> saw immediately one of the paramount reasons for the spread of the unorthodox movement: <b6_0>the representatives of the Holy Church<b6_0/> acted and moved <a0_0>with an offensive amount of pomp and ceremony<a0_0/>. On the other hand, <a1_0><b7_0>the Cathars<b7_0/><a1_0/> lived <a2_0><b8_0>in a state of self-sacrifice<b8_0/><a2_0/> that was widely appealing. For these reasons, Prior Diego suggested that the papal legates begin to live a reformed apostolic life. The legates agreed to change if they could find <a3_0>a strong leader<a3_0/>. The prior took up the challenge, and he and Dominic dedicated themselves to the conversion of the Albigensians. Despite this particular mission, in <b9_0>winning <a4_0>the Albigensians<a4_0/> over by persuasion Dominic<b9_0/> met limited success, "for though in his ten years of preaching a large number of converts were made, it has to be said that the results were not such as had been hoped for."
